title: Louise Millar - 3 Novels (Epub)
description:
Louise Millar - 3 Novels (Epub)



01. The Playdate (July 2012): TAKE NOTHING FOR GRANTED. . .

In a quiet London suburb, a group of mothers relies on each other for friendship, favors, and gossip. But some of them shouldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t be trusted, and others have dark secrets.

When Callie moved into her new neighborhood, she thought it would be easy to fit in. The other parents have been strangely hostile, though, and her frail daughter Rae is finding it impossible to make friends. Suzy, with her rich husband and her three energetic children, has been the only one to reach out, although their friendship has recently felt inexplicably strained. Now the police have suggested that someone dangerous may be living in their neighborhood, and the atmosphere feels even more toxic. Then thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s the matter of CallieÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ex-husband, and the shocking truth behind their divorce... A truth that she would do anything to hide.

02. Accidents Happen (April 2013): What if the one in a million is you? How many times, when things go wrong, have you said to yourself "Why me"?

Some people seem to have more than their fair share of bad luck, and Kate Parker is one of them. Kate has weathered unimaginable horrorsÃ¢â‚¬â€her parents died in a traffic accident on her wedding night, and her husband, Hugo, was murdered in a tragic break-in gone wrong. All she has left is her young son, Jack, and, determined to make a better future for him, she attempts to pull her life back together. But are she and her son safe?

So when Kate and her ten-year-old son Jack move to Oxford to start a new life, Kate is determined that events of the past will not come back to haunt them. Despite the suffocating support she receives from her overbearing in-laws, she starts to feel threatened. Somehow her comfortable family home doesn't feel quite safe Ã¢â‚¬â€œ it's almost as though someone is watching them. But then a chance meeting with a charming Oxford professor helps to convince her that she can overcome her fears, and that she and Jack can start to live a normal life once again. But just when she feels happier than she's felt in years, a shocking revelation blows all of their lives apart.


03. The Hidden Girl (May 2014): From Ã¢â‚¬Å“a writer to watchÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (Booklist), this gripping psychological thriller follows a young woman who uncovers a terrible secret in her idyllic suburban neighborhoodÃ¢â‚¬â€but who will believe her?

How do you look for someone who's not even missing?

Hannah Riley and her musician husband, Will, hope that a move to the Suffolk countryside will promise a fresh start.

Hannah, a human rights worker, is desperate for a child and she hopes that this new life will realise her dream.

Yet when the snow comes, Will is working in London and Hannah is cut off in their remote village. Life in Tornley turns out to be far from idyllic, who are the threatening figures who lurk near their property at night? And why is her neighbour so keen to see them leave? Plus Will's, behaviour is severely testing the bonds of her trust.

Hannah has spent her professional life doing the right thing for other people. But as she starts to unbury a terrible crime, she realises she can no longer do that without putting everything she's ever wanted at risk.

But if she does nothing, the next victim could be her...
